alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 4:26PM MST until August 24 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Paria River in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST /830 PM MDT/. * At 425 PM MST /525 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Paria River. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Paria River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paria Canyon, Paria River Slot Canyon, Lee`s Ferry CG, Paria Beach, Lee`s Ferry, Lees Ferry, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River and Paria River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry in the next few hours. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
